intro: Epilobium montanum subsp. duriaei, commonly known as the alpine willow herb, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and lanceolate leaves. The flowers are typically pink to purple, arranged in clusters, and are borne on long pedicels. It thrives in rocky or alpine habitats, often growing at high altitudes where conditions are harsh. This subspecies is notable for its adaptability to cold climates and its role in stabilizing soil in mountainous environments.
